prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Ahlbi Ur'gaid
Description: My guide. This industrious young man is both a monk in training and a Khura'inese tour guide.
Character 1
Name: Maya Fey
Description: A practitioner of the Kurain Channeling Technique. We used to take on all sorts of cases together.
Character 2
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A detective with a love of science. She's finally achieved her dream of becoming a forensic investigator.
Character 3
Name: Tahrust Inmee
Description: Khura'inist high priest in charge of the rites of Lady Kee'ra. Killed during the Purification Rite. Has a clergyman's mark on his brow.
Character 4
Name: Nahyuta Sahdmadhi
Description: A Khura'inese prosecutor and monk. He's also known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."
Character 5
Name: Rayfa Padma Khura'in
Description: A Khura'inist priestess and crown princess of Khura'in. Her Divination Séances show the last moments of the dead.
Character 6
Name: Puhray Zeh'lot
Description: An apprentice priest living in the high priest's house. He's like part of the family.
Character 7
Name: ??? → Datz Are'bal
Description: A strange guy. You can't see his face on account of his beard. Pretty suspicious, if you ask me.
Character 8
Name: Beh'leeb Inmee
Description: Widow of the victim. She usually plays the part of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My all-important badge. Proof of my profession.
Evidence 1
Name: Rites Guide
Description: A guide to Khura'inese rites written for tourists.
Evidence 2
Name: May 9th Newspaper
Description: A newspaper from the morning of the Purification Rite. It reports on the weather and Lady Kee'ra's activities, among other things.
Evidence 3
Name: Tahrust's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was blood loss from an abdominal wound delivered by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 4
Name: Ritual Curtain
Description: A curtain around the perimeter of the sanctum, isolating it from the outside world. The entrance was shut during the rite.
Evidence 5
Name: Bloodstained Letter
Description: A letter we found at the Inner Sanctum. A giant bloodstain makes it impossible to read in full.
Evidence 6
Name: Sanctum Prayer Flags
Description: Prayer flags found outside of the ritual curtain. They have been sewn together into a long banner.
Evidence 7
Name: Inner Sanctum Photo
Description: Shows the high priest's body, a shoveled-out area of snow, and a lantern with a broken wind guard.
Evidence 8
Name: Maya's Statement
Description: On the day of the rite, the water in the spring was already stained red when Abbot Inmee and Maya arrived at the Inner Sanctum.
Evidence 9
Name: Lady Kee'ra's Warning
Description: A warning from Lady Kee'ra to Abbot Inmee. Only someone capable of entering the priest's home could have delivered it.
Evidence 10
Name: Warbaa'd Arrow
Description: Resembles the three-pronged arrows once used by Lady Kee'ra. Discovered near the high priest's home.
Evidence 11
Name: Mountain Range Poster
Description: A poster and a photograph of the entire Inner Sanctum and Mt. Poniponi area.
Evidence 12
Name: Envelope
Description: An envelope addressed to the high priest. There is no return address, and three unusual-looking holes are punched into it.
Evidence 13
Name: Wanted Poster
Description: A wanted poster describing the escaped prisoner. Mentions a sizeable reward.
Evidence 14
Name: Plumed Punisher Strap
Description: This one-of-a-kind strap plays "The Plumed Punisher" theme when the magatama on her belt is pressed.
Evidence 15
Name: Inner Sanctum Diagram
Description: Shows where Maya and the high priest were during the rite.
Evidence 16
Name: Crime Photo (Zeh'lot)
Description: Killed in the Plaza of Devotion. He has a peach-shaped tattoo on the nape of his neck.
Rayfa:
All members of the Khura'inist clergy have such marks upon them.
Evidence 17
Name: Zeh'lot's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was a spinal cord injury from being stabbed in the upper back by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 18
Name: Warbaa'd Dagger
Description: A dagger modeled after a warbaa'd. Said to have been used by Lady Kee'ra.
Evidence 19
Name: Brand New Flag
Description: A brand-new prayer flag found at the Plaza of Devotion. Has some writing on it.
Evidence 20
Name: Nahmanda Flower
Description: A flower the Khura'inese use to pay tribute to the departed. Expresses heartfelt sympathy.
Evidence 21
Name: Beh'leeb's Statement
Description: A statement about the Feast of Blessings that was held the day before the rite.
Evidence 22
Name: Family Photo
Description: A picture of Maya and the high priest's family taken during the Feast of Blessings on the day before the rite.
Evidence 23
Name: Tome of Secrets
Description: A tome given only to the one who will play the role of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite. It reads: The priestess acting as Lady Kee'ra's representative must know her name and have seen her face. That name is Ihmsan. Speaking this name is unforgivable. Lock this knowledge deep in your heart, and devote yourself to prayer. [caption] There is an image of the goddess. She is doing a ritual dance, holding a bird-shaped dagger in her right hand. She is wearing a mask and a tiara.
Evidence 24
Name: Dhurke's Law Book
Description: Branding it with the Defiant Dragons mark demonstrates the strength of Dhurke's convictions.
Evidence 25
Name: Golden Orb
Description: An orb entrusted to me by Mr. Are'bal. It seems to be the key to the rebel hideout.
Evidence 26
Name: Rebel Hideout Photo
Description: A photo of the secret rebel hideout. There was a luminol reaction near the entrance. [caption] There are two upright stone slabs, straddling over a stream of water. There is a small table and some stools. Tools are scarttered. A photo of the secret rebel hideout. It is just as Abbot Inmee saw it after the incident.
Evidence 27
Name: Warbaa'd Statue
Description: Its sharp, protruding feathers took Puhray Zeh'lot's life. It's also a revolving door.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: The latest victim was Puhray Zeh'lot.
Person: Ema
Testimony 1
Testimony: He had been training under the high priest, and living at his house for the past two years.
Person: Ema
Testimony 2
Testimony: The high priest's widow Beh'leeb Inmee has identified the victim's body.
Person: Ema
Testimony 3
Testimony: He was an illegal immigrant, so we don't know his real name.
Person: Ema
Testimony 4
Testimony: He may have been mistaken for a rebel and killed due to his connection to the high priest.
Person: Ema

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, let's tackle this. The question is asking which evidence and testimony contradict each other. I need to go through each testimony and see if any of the evidence directly contradicts it.

First, let's look at the testimonies provided by Ema. Testimony 3 says, "He was an illegal immigrant, so we don't know his real name." The key point here is that they don't know his real name because he's an illegal immigrant. Now, looking at the evidence list, Evidence 16 is the Crime Photo (Zeh'lot) which mentions that the victim has a peach-shaped tattoo on the nape of his neck. Rayfa's comment on this evidence states that all members of the Khura'inist clergy have such marks. 

Wait, if Puhray Zeh'lot has the clergyman's mark (the tattoo), then he must be part of the clergy. But according to the testimony, he's an illegal immigrant whose real name is unknown. However, in the Characters list, Character 6 is Puhray Zeh'lot, described as an apprentice priest living in the high priest's house. Being part of the clergy would typically mean he's recognized by the religious institution, which might conflict with being an illegal immigrant whose identity is unknown. But maybe in Khura'in, being part of the clergy doesn't require legal citizenship? Hmm.

Wait, no. Let me check the evidence again. Evidence 16's Crime Photo says Zeh'lot has the peach-shaped tattoo, and Rayfa mentions that all clergy members have such marks. So Zeh'lot is part of the clergy. But the testimony says he's an illegal immigrant whose real name is unknown. If he's part of the clergy, wouldn't they know his real name? Or is it possible that he joined the clergy under a false identity as an illegal immigrant? Maybe, but the contradiction arises if the clergy's policy requires members to be legal residents. However, the problem is that the testimony and evidence might directly contradict in another way.

Wait, looking at Evidence 16, the description of the Crime Photo (Zeh'lot) says he has the tattoo, which according to Rayfa, all clergy members have. So Zeh'lot is indeed a member of the clergy. But Testimony 3 says he was an illegal immigrant whose real name is unknown. However, in Character 6, his name is Puhray Zeh'lot, and he's an apprentice priest. If he's part of the clergy and living with the high priest for two years (Testimony 1), perhaps the clergy would have records of his real name. So the testimony claims they don't know his real name because he's an illegal immigrant, but the fact that he's a clergy member with a mark suggests they should know his identity. That might be the contradiction.

Alternatively, maybe the tattoo is a clergy mark that's only given to legitimate members, implying that he couldn't be an illegal immigrant with an unknown name. Therefore, Testimony 3 (saying he's an illegal immigrant with unknown real name) contradicts Evidence 16 (showing he's a clergy member with the mark, which should require proper identification). So the pair would be Evidence 16 and Testimony 3. But wait, Evidence 16's description says he has the tattoo, and Rayfa's comment supports that clergy members have it. So the contradiction is that if he's a clergy member, they should know his real name, but the testimony says they don't. Therefore, the testimony and evidence conflict here.

Wait, but maybe the testimony is from Ema, who is a detective. She might not have access to clergy records, so even if he's part of the clergy, as an illegal immigrant, his real name might still be unknown. Hmm. But if he's an apprentice priest under the high priest for two years (Testimony 1), perhaps the high priest's family would know his real name. Wait, Testimony 2 says the high priest's widow identified the body. So Beh'leeb Inmee identified him, but if he was living with them for two years, maybe they knew him by his alias, but his real name was still unknown. So the contradiction isn't clear here.

Let me look for another possible contradiction. Let's check other testimonies and evidence. Testimony 4 says he may have been mistaken for a rebel and killed due to his connection to the high priest. Looking at Evidence 13, the Wanted Poster mentions an escaped prisoner with a reward. If the rebels are being targeted, maybe the dagger (Evidence 18) or other evidence connects. Not sure.

Alternatively, Testimony 0 says the latest victim was Puhray Zeh'lot. But Evidence 16 is his crime photo, which aligns. So no contradiction there.

Wait, Evidence 3: Tahrust's Autopsy Report says he died from an abdominal wound. Evidence 17: Zeh'lot's Autopsy Report says he was stabbed in the upper back. No contradiction here.

Looking at Evidence 19: Brand New Flag found at Plaza of Devotion with writing. Testimony 4 suggests he was killed due to rebel connections. Maybe the flag's writing relates, but not sure.

Another angle: The testimony that says he's an illegal immigrant (Testimony 3) and Evidence 16 (his clergy mark). If being part of the clergy requires legal status, then he can't be an illegal immigrant. But the game's setting might allow clergy members to be immigrants. However, the contradiction could be that the clergy mark (tattoo) is only for recognized clergy members, which would imply that his identity is known to the clergy, thus contradicting the testimony that his real name is unknown because he's illegal.

Alternatively, the contradiction is between Testimony 3 (illegal immigrant, real name unknown) and Evidence 16 (clergy mark). Since clergy members are known, but they don't know his real name. Therefore, the existence of the clergy mark (indicating he's a recognized member) contradicts the testimony that they don't know his real name. So the pair would be Evidence 16 and Testimony 3.

Testimony 4

Testimony 5

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other. So first, I need to look through the testimonies and see if any of them don't line up with the evidence provided.

Looking at the testimonies, Testimony 3 by Tahrust says that the quarrel was between Zeh'lot and Maya Fey. But wait, there's Evidence 8, which is Maya's statement. According to Evidence 8, when Maya and the Abbot arrived at the Inner Sanctum, the water was already red. That suggests Maya was with the Abbot when the crime happened. If Tahrust claims Maya was arguing with Zeh'lot, but Maya's own statement puts her at the Inner Sanctum at the time, that's a contradiction. Because if she was at the Inner Sanctum, she couldn't be arguing with Zeh'lot elsewhere. So Testimony 3 (which implicates Maya) is contradicted by Evidence 8 (Maya's alibi).

cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem. We need to find which evidence contradicts one of the testimonies. The characters, evidence, and testimonies provided are all from a case, probably from the Ace Attorney game series. 

First, I'll look through the testimonies. The testimonies given are all from Tahrust Inmee (Character 3). The key points in his testimonies are that Maya Fey (Character 1) channeled Lady Kee'ra's spirit, that she knew the true name (Ihmsan) which allowed her to do so, and that Lady Kee'ra killed him with superhuman strength.

Now, looking at the evidence. The Tome of Secrets (Evidence 23) is crucial here. It states that the priestess acting as Lady Kee'ra must know her name (Ihmsan) and have seen her face. But according to Maya's Statement (Evidence 8), when she and the Abbot arrived at the Inner Sanctum, the water was already red. If the rite hadn't started yet, Maya might not have had the Tome of Secrets at that point. Wait, but the Tome is given only to the one who plays Lady Kee'ra. If Maya was supposed to channel Lady Kee'ra, she would need the Tome to know the name Ihmsan. However, if the murder happened before the rite began, maybe Maya hadn't received the Tome yet. But wait, Evidence 23 says the Tome is given to the one who will play Lady Kee'ra. So Maya should have had it before the rite. But if the water was already red when she arrived, perhaps the murder occurred before she could even start the rite. That might mean she didn't have the Tome yet. Hmm, maybe not directly. Let me check the testimonies again.

Testimony 1 by Tahrust says that Maya knew the true name, so she could have done it (channeled Lady Kee'ra). But according to the Tome of Secrets (Evidence 23), the name Ihmsan is a secret that must be locked away and not spoken. If Maya had the Tome, she would know the name. But the contradiction arises if there's evidence that Maya didn't actually know the name, or couldn't have known it. Wait, but if the Tome is given only to the person playing Lady Kee'ra, then Maya should have it. However, if the murder happened before she could receive the Tome, then she wouldn't know the name, contradicting Tahrust's testimony that she did. But according to Evidence 8 (Maya's Statement), when they arrived at the Inner Sanctum, the water was already red, implying the murder had already occurred. So Maya wouldn't have had the chance to perform the rite, meaning she might not have the Tome yet. Therefore, she couldn't have known the name Ihmsan, contradicting Testimony 1 which claims she knew the name. Therefore, Evidence 23 (Tome of Secrets) contradicts Testimony 1. Wait, but Evidence 23's description says the Tome is given to the one who will play Lady Kee'ra. If Maya was chosen to play Lady Kee'ra, she would have received the Tome beforehand. But if the murder happened before the rite, perhaps she hadn't yet received it. Alternatively, maybe the Tome was given in advance. The timing here is key.
